homepage.bodyText: Welcome! My name is Scott j Sullivan and this would be my simple portfolio site, with outdated updates and pending additions. Please poke around...

sites.site_bio:
This microsite template is fully customizable in which all borders, buttons, and icons are easily interchangeable in terms of color and theme. The site was an option for clients to choose from in a list of single page sites; used to endorse, give information about their virtual event, and promote audiences to participate before the event started.

This site was built back in 2010, so some elements are quiet outdated by now. Feel free to view the site and its self standing pages in the link below.

A guide listing out all the useful scripts for fixing things on Platform Builder and on events. Built website to contain all JavaScript, ActionSript and XHTML scripts in a user friendly manner.

This site was built back in 2009, so some elements are quiet outdated by now. Feel free to view the site and its self standing pages in the link below.

An informative website built in the interest of eating healthy snacks and meals. The site is broken down for parents looking to make a healthy snack, meal or partake in a fitness activity with their kids.

This site was built back in 2009, so some elements are quiet outdated by now. Feel free to view the site and its flash counterpoint in the link below.
A website idea for a gym specializing in combat and fitness. The website was never developed but the overall theme and content carried over to a wordpress website.

A simple registration page with event information. The clean and crisp design was used for clients looking to make a registration page that didn't need to exactly match their event, thus making the registration page easy to setup.
A class website that was created to showcase and cell our school magazine. There was a Flash version built alongside the standard website.

A marketing website for a quarterly MMA event. The site sold tickets and gave information to over 2,000+ viewers per event. The site was later replaced by a wordpress template for simpler client updates.

A gallery that showcased all of the offered backgrounds for the new VX platform. This was used as a marketing tool to show the clients the posibilities they had within the platform.

This site was built back in 2009, so some elements are quiet outdated by now. Feel free to view the site and its self standing pages in the link below.

A concept website for information pertaining to our rights and daily news about the topic. There is a 13 step information section with a fully functional quiz section at the end.

This site was built back in 2009, so some elements are quiet outdated by now. Feel free to view the site and its self standing pages in the link below.
This template is fully customizable in terms of theme and content. It is completely compatable with IE6+, Firefox, and Safari. It was used for clients to market their up and coming virtual events.
A school project website containing a listing of local breweries listed by state. A full database, customer logins, brewery entry and search fuctionality for over 200+ micro brewers.
My old portfolio website that displayed all of my work in a jQuery based slider. This site has been outdated since my graduation in September of 2010.

missing_person.title: Missing Person Music
missing_person.site_bio:
A small hobby of mine, pilaging the librarys of music's past to create new molds driven on samples, soft/hard hitting basses and hip-hop breakbeat drums. With well over 60+ songs and 3 album collaberations for full-length LPs with other local same-minded musicians.

View my soundcloud page to see some of my highlighted and newer tracks or delve deep into my soundclick account to see over 5 years of instrumentals.

contact_info.title:
Hello, you must be here to view some of my whereabouts in the world of the web. I have been coding and designing user friendly websites for a couple years now. I started designing flash sites and find myself coding as a front end user experience developer. Enjoy dabbling in music production and look for odd beauties with my photography work. Feel free to contact me, if you see it necessarily needful.

Thanks & Enjoy,
contact_info.update:
Currently I am not looking for any new projects or work outside of my 9-5 job. I am availible for current projects past 6 on weekdays and weekends.




Sincerely,


Scott j Sullivan
